segment.source: Export restrictions on cryptography
segment.target: Export restrictions on cryptography

segment.source: Use this info to determine if your app uses cryptography in a way that might prevent it from being listed in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Use this info to determine if your app uses cryptography in a way that might prevent it from being listed in the Windows Store.

segment.source: Export restrictions on cryptography
segment.target: Export restrictions on cryptography

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: Use this info to determine if your app uses cryptography in a way that might prevent it from being listed in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Use this info to determine if your app uses cryptography in a way that might prevent it from being listed in the Windows Store.

segment.source: The Bureau of Industry and Security in the United States Department of Commerce regulates the export of technology that uses certain types of encryption.
segment.target: The Bureau of Industry and Security in the United States Department of Commerce regulates the export of technology that uses certain types of encryption.

segment.source: All apps listed in the Windows Store must comply with these laws and regulations because the app files can be stored in the United States.
segment.target: All apps listed in the Windows Store must comply with these laws and regulations because the app files can be stored in the United States.

segment.source: Even apps that are uploaded by app developers from other countries for distribution outside of the United States must comply with these regulations.
segment.target: Even apps that are uploaded by app developers from other countries for distribution outside of the United States must comply with these regulations.

segment.source: Consequently, when submitting an app to the Windows Store, all app developers must make sure that their apps don't contain any technology that is restricted by these regulations.
segment.target: Consequently, when submitting an app to the Windows Store, all app developers must make sure that their apps don't contain any technology that is restricted by these regulations.

segment.source: Note The information provided here provides some guidance, but it is your responsibility as the app developer who is publishing apps in the Windows Store to make sure that your app complies with all applicable laws and regulations.
segment.target: Note The information provided here provides some guidance, but it is your responsibility as the app developer who is publishing apps in the Windows Store to make sure that your app complies with all applicable laws and regulations.

segment.source: For more info about the U.S. Department of Commerce and the Bureau of Industry and Security, see About the Bureau of Industry and Security.
segment.target: For more info about the U.S. Department of Commerce and the Bureau of Industry and Security, see About the Bureau of Industry and Security.

segment.source: For info about the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) that govern the export of technology that includes encryption, see EAR Controls for Items That Use Encryption.
segment.target: For info about the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) that govern the export of technology that includes encryption, see EAR Controls for Items That Use Encryption.

segment.source: Governed uses
segment.target: Governed uses

segment.source: First, determine if your app uses a type of cryptography that is governed by the Export Administration Regulations.
segment.target: First, determine if your app uses a type of cryptography that is governed by the Export Administration Regulations.

segment.source: The question includes the examples shown in the list here; but remember that this list doesn't include every possible application of cryptography.
segment.target: The question includes the examples shown in the list here; but remember that this list doesn't include every possible application of cryptography.

segment.source: Important Consider not only the code you wrote for your app, but also all the software libraries, utilities and operating system components that your app includes or links to.
segment.target: Important Consider not only the code you wrote for your app, but also all the software libraries, utilities and operating system components that your app includes or links to.

segment.source: Any use of a digital signature, such as authentication or integrity checking
segment.target: Any use of a digital signature, such as authentication or integrity checking

segment.source: Encryption of any data or files that your app uses or accesses
segment.target: Encryption of any data or files that your app uses or accesses

segment.source: Key management, certificate management, or anything that interacts with a public key infrastructure
segment.target: Key management, certificate management, or anything that interacts with a public key infrastructure

segment.source: Using a secure communication channel such as NTLM, Kerberos, Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), or Transport Layer Security (TLS)
segment.target: Using a secure communication channel such as NTLM, Kerberos, Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), or Transport Layer Security (TLS)

segment.source: Encrypting passwords or other forms of information security
segment.target: Encrypting passwords or other forms of information security

segment.source: Copy protection or digital rights management (DRM)
segment.target: Copy protection or digital rights management (DRM)

segment.source: Antivirus protection
segment.target: Antivirus protection

segment.source: For the complete and current list of cryptographic applications, see EAR Controls for Items That Use Encryption.
segment.target: For the complete and current list of cryptographic applications, see EAR Controls for Items That Use Encryption.

segment.source: Non-restricted uses
segment.target: Non-restricted uses

segment.source: Note that some of the applications of cryptography are not restricted.
segment.target: Note that some of the applications of cryptography are not restricted.

segment.source: Here are the unrestricted tasks:
segment.target: Here are the unrestricted tasks:

segment.source: Password encryption
segment.target: Password encryption

segment.source: Copy protection
segment.target: Copy protection

segment.source: Authentication
segment.target: Authentication

segment.source: Digital rights management
segment.target: Digital rights management

segment.source: Using digital signatures
segment.target: Using digital signatures

segment.source: For the complete and current list of cryptographic applications, see EAR Controls for Items That Use Encryption.
segment.target: For the complete and current list of cryptographic applications, see EAR Controls for Items That Use Encryption.

segment.source: If your app calls, supports, contains, or uses cryptography or encryption for any task that is not in this list, it needs an Export Commodity Classification Number (ECCN).
segment.target: If your app calls, supports, contains, or uses cryptography or encryption for any task that is not in this list, it needs an Export Commodity Classification Number (ECCN).

segment.source: If you don't have an ECCN, see ECCN Questions and Answers.
segment.target: If you don't have an ECCN, see ECCN Questions and Answers.
